publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2276# Trish Godman: The Future of Clydeside Shipyards—That the Parliament offers its compliments to the managements, workforces and trade union representatives of the shipyards of lower and upper Clyde who, over and beyond the superb ships they build, work so hard and in a spirit of co-operation to ensure that their maritime industry continues as a viable and important element of the local economies; believes that it is essential that the fine skills, employed in the yards, should be maintained and enhanced by sound apprenticeship schemes, and considers that the Scottish Executive should do everything in its power, on its own account and in co-operation with the appropriate UK ministers, to assist our Clydeside yards to secure vessel orders.
S2M-2276 #The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Jackie Baillie*, Bill Butler*
S2M-2276 #The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) John Swinburne*

S2M-2276 #The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Chris Ballance*, Cathie Craigie*, Pauline McNeill*, Michael McMahon*, Mike Watson*, Robert Brown*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Tricia Marwick*, Murray Tosh*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Robin Harper*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Rob Gibson*, Tommy Sheridan*, Alex Neil*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Christine May*
S2M-2276# The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Shiona Baird*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-2276# The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Bristow Muldoon*, Gordon Jackson*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2276 #The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Elaine Smith*, Jim Mather*, Sarah Boyack*
S2M-2276# The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Dr Jean Turner*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Linda Fabiani*
S2M-2276 #The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Susan Deacon*
S2M-2276 #The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S2M-2276# The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-2276# The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Frances Curran*

S2M-2276# Trish Godman: The Future of Clydeside Shipyards—That the Parliament offers its compliments to the managements, workforces and trade union representatives of the shipyards of lower and upper Clyde who, over and beyond the superb ships they build, work so hard and in a spirit of co-operation to ensure that their maritime industry continues as a viable and important element of the local economies; believes that it is essential that the fine skills, employed in the yards, should be maintained and enhanced by sound apprenticeship schemes, and considers that the Scottish Executive should do everything in its power, on its own account and in co-operation with the appropriate UK ministers, to assist our Clydeside yards to secure vessel orders. Supported by: Jackie Baillie, Bill Butler, John Swinburne, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Chris Ballance, Cathie Craigie, Pauline McNeill, Michael McMahon, Mike Watson, Robert Brown, Ms Wendy Alexander, Tricia Marwick, Murray Tosh, Roseanna Cunningham, Robin Harper, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Rob Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Christine May, Shiona Baird, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Bristow Muldoon, Gordon Jackson, Donald Gorrie, Elaine Smith, Jim Mather, Sarah Boyack, Dr Jean Turner, Mr John Home Robertson, Linda Fabiani, Susan Deacon, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Cathy Peattie, Frances Curran Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-2276 #The Future of Clydeside Shipyards (lodged on 19 January 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*
